channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: CloudS2Mask: A novel deep learning approach for improved cloud and cloud shadow masking in Sentinel-2 imagery
item.description: Precise and efficient cloud and cloud shadow masking methods are required for the automated use of this data.

item.title: Cross-Domain Feature Augmentation for Domain Generalization
item.description: Existing methods focus on learning invariance across domains to enhance model robustness, and data augmentation has been widely used to learn invariant predictors, with most methods performing augmentation in the input space.

item.title: Energy-based Hopfield Boosting for Out-of-Distribution Detection
item.description: Out-of-distribution (OOD) detection is critical when deploying machine learning models in the real world.

item.title: Self-Distillation Improves DNA Sequence Inference
item.description: Self-supervised pretraining (SSP) has been recognized as a method to enhance prediction accuracy in various downstream tasks.

item.title: Dual-level Hypergraph Contrastive Learning with Adaptive Temperature Enhancement
item.description: However, these works have the following limitations in modeling the high-order relationships over unlabeled data: (i) They primarily focus on maximizing the agreements among individual node embeddings while neglecting the capture of group-wise collective behaviors within hypergraphs; (ii) Most of them disregard the importance of the temperature index in discriminating contrastive pairs during contrast optimization.

item.title: Improving Transformers with Dynamically Composable Multi-Head Attention
item.description: At the core of DCMHA is a $\it{Compose}$ function that transforms the attention score and weight matrices in an input-dependent way.

item.title: StraightPCF: Straight Point Cloud Filtering
item.description: Point cloud filtering is a fundamental 3D vision task, which aims to remove noise while recovering the underlying clean surfaces.

item.title: Hunyuan-DiT: A Powerful Multi-Resolution Diffusion Transformer with Fine-Grained Chinese Understanding
item.description: For fine-grained language understanding, we train a Multimodal Large Language Model to refine the captions of the images.

item.title: RDPN6D: Residual-based Dense Point-wise Network for 6Dof Object Pose Estimation Based on RGB-D Images
item.description: In this work, we introduce a novel method for calculating the 6DoF pose of an object using a single RGB-D image.

item.title: Efficient Vision-Language Pre-training by Cluster Masking
item.description: We propose a simple strategy for masking image patches during visual-language contrastive learning that improves the quality of the learned representations and the training speed.

item.title: Multimodal Collaboration Networks for Geospatial Vehicle Detection in Dense, Occluded, and Large-Scale Events
item.description: To this end, we first construct two multimodal dense and occlusion vehicle detection datasets for large-scale events, utilizing RGB and height map modalities.

item.title: Achieving Fairness Through Channel Pruning for Dermatological Disease Diagnosis
item.description: Numerous studies have revealed that deep learning-based medical image classification models may exhibit bias towards specific demographic attributes, such as race, gender, and age.

item.title: EndoDAC: Efficient Adapting Foundation Model for Self-Supervised Depth Estimation from Any Endoscopic Camera
item.description: We propose Endoscopic Depth Any Camera (EndoDAC) which is an efficient self-supervised depth estimation framework that adapts foundation models to endoscopic scenes.

item.title: EfficientTrain++: Generalized Curriculum Learning for Efficient Visual Backbone Training
item.description: These patterns, when observed through frequency and spatial domains, incorporate lower-frequency components, and the natural image contents without distortion or data augmentation.

item.title: TEDNet: Twin Encoder Decoder Neural Network for 2D Camera and LiDAR Road Detection
item.description: Robust road surface estimation is required for autonomous ground vehicles to navigate safely.

item.title: Evaluating LLMs at Evaluating Temporal Generalization
item.description: The rapid advancement of Large Language Models (LLMs) highlights the urgent need for evolving evaluation methodologies that keep pace with improvements in language comprehension and information processing.

item.title: Shape-aware synthesis of pathological lung CT scans using CycleGAN for enhanced semi-supervised lung segmentation
item.description: The lung surrounding is derived based on ground truth lung masks available in the healthy domain.

item.title: No Time to Waste: Squeeze Time into Channel for Mobile Video Understanding
item.description: In this paper, we propose to squeeze the time axis of a video sequence into the channel dimension and present a lightweight video recognition network, term as \textit{SqueezeTime}, for mobile video understanding.

item.title: Generalizing Knowledge Graph Embedding with Universal Orthogonal Parameterization
item.description: Recent advances in knowledge graph embedding (KGE) rely on Euclidean/hyperbolic orthogonal relation transformations to model intrinsic logical patterns and topological structures.

item.title: MS MARCO Web Search: a Large-scale Information-rich Web Dataset with Millions of Real Click Labels
item.description: Recent breakthroughs in large models have highlighted the critical significance of data scale, labels and modals.

item.title: DeepHYDRA: Resource-Efficient Time-Series Anomaly Detection in Dynamically-Configured Systems
item.description: A downside of such methods is that they require a static input size, or lose data through cropping, sampling, or other dimensionality reduction methods, making deployment on systems with variability on monitored data channels, such as computing clusters difficult.

item.title: PARDEN, Can You Repeat That? Defending against Jailbreaks via Repetition
item.description: A promising approach is to use the LLM itself as the safeguard.

item.title: Synergistic Integration of Coordinate Network and Tensorial Feature for Improving Neural Radiance Fields from Sparse Inputs
item.description: However, it has limitations in capturing low-frequency details and tends to overuse parameters for low-frequency features due to its bias toward fine details, despite its multi-resolution concept.

item.title: An Empirical Study on the Robustness of Massively Multilingual Neural Machine Translation
item.description: Massively multilingual neural machine translation (MMNMT) has been proven to enhance the translation quality of low-resource languages.

item.title: RLHF Workflow: From Reward Modeling to Online RLHF
item.description: We present the workflow of Online Iterative Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback (RLHF) in this technical report, which is widely reported to outperform its offline counterpart by a large margin in the recent large language model (LLM) literature.

item.title: RESTAD: REconstruction and Similarity based Transformer for time series Anomaly Detection
item.description: This layer fits a non-parametric density in the latent representation, such that a high RBF output indicates similarity with predominantly normal training data.

item.title: DEPTH: Discourse Education through Pre-Training Hierarchically
item.description: Language Models (LMs) often struggle with linguistic understanding at the discourse level, even though discourse patterns such as coherence, cohesion, and narrative flow are prevalent in their pre-training data.

item.title: LlamaTurk: Adapting Open-Source Generative Large Language Models for Low-Resource Language
item.description: Despite advancements in English-dominant generative large language models, further development is needed for low-resource languages to enhance global accessibility.

item.title: FreeVA: Offline MLLM as Training-Free Video Assistant
item.description: The study provides an essential, yet must-know baseline, and reveals several surprising findings: 1) FreeVA, leveraging only offline image-based MLLM without additional training, excels in zero-shot video question-answering (e. g., MSVD-QA, ActivityNet-QA, and MSRVTT-QA), even surpassing state-of-the-art methods that involve video instruction tuning.

item.title: The Platonic Representation Hypothesis
item.description: We argue that representations in AI models, particularly deep networks, are converging.

item.title: Constrained Exploration via Reflected Replica Exchange Stochastic Gradient Langevin Dynamics
item.description: Replica exchange stochastic gradient Langevin dynamics (reSGLD) is an effective sampler for non-convex learning in large-scale datasets.

item.title: Deep Learning-Based Object Pose Estimation: A Comprehensive Survey
item.description: Object pose estimation is a fundamental computer vision problem with broad applications in augmented reality and robotics.

item.title: MambaOut: Do We Really Need Mamba for Vision?
item.description: For vision tasks, as image classification does not align with either characteristic, we hypothesize that Mamba is not necessary for this task; Detection and segmentation tasks are also not autoregressive, yet they adhere to the long-sequence characteristic, so we believe it is still worthwhile to explore Mamba's potential for these tasks.

item.title: PromptLink: Leveraging Large Language Models for Cross-Source Biomedical Concept Linking
item.description: Furthermore, PromptLink is a generic framework without reliance on additional prior knowledge, context, or training data, making it well-suited for concept linking across various types of data sources.

item.title: Binning as a Pretext Task: Improving Self-Supervised Learning in Tabular Domains
item.description: The ability of deep networks to learn superior representations hinges on leveraging the proper inductive biases, considering the inherent properties of datasets.

item.title: OverlapMamba: Novel Shift State Space Model for LiDAR-based Place Recognition
item.description: In a novel way, we employ a stochastic reconstruction approach to build shift state space models, compressing the visual representation.

item.title: MacBehaviour: An R package for behavioural experimentation on large language models
item.description: In summary, "MacBehaviour" is an R package for machine behaviour studies which offers a user-friendly interface and comprehensive features to simplify and standardize the experimental process.

item.title: Modeling of Time-varying Wireless Communication Channel with Fading and Shadowing
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new approach that combines a deep learning neural network with a mixture density network model to derive the conditional probability density function (PDF) of receiving power given a communication distance in general wireless communication systems.

item.title: Localized Adaptive Risk Control
item.description: Adaptive Risk Control (ARC) is an online calibration strategy based on set prediction that offers worst-case deterministic long-term risk control, as well as statistical marginal coverage guarantees.

item.title: AnomalyLLM: Few-shot Anomaly Edge Detection for Dynamic Graphs using Large Language Models
item.description: With the evolving of time, the types of anomaly edges are emerging and the labeled anomaly samples are few for each type.

item.title: PeRFlow: Piecewise Rectified Flow as Universal Plug-and-Play Accelerator
item.description: We present Piecewise Rectified Flow (PeRFlow), a flow-based method for accelerating diffusion models.

item.title: Sakuga-42M Dataset: Scaling Up Cartoon Research
item.description: Can we harness the success of the scaling paradigm to benefit cartoon research?

item.title: A Unified Sequence Parallelism Approach for Long Context Generative AI
item.description: Sequence parallelism (SP), which divides the sequence dimension of input tensors across multiple computational devices, is becoming key to unlocking the long-context capabilities of generative AI models.

item.title: CANTONMT: Investigating Back-Translation and Model-Switch Mechanisms for Cantonese-English Neural Machine Translation
item.description: To achieve this, a new parallel corpus has been created by combining different available corpora online with preprocessing and cleaning.

item.title: Evaluation of Retrieval-Augmented Generation: A Survey
item.description: We consequently enhanced an extensive survey and proposed an analysis framework for benchmarks of RAG systems, RAGR (Retrieval, Generation, Additional Requirement), designed to systematically analyze RAG benchmarks by focusing on measurable outputs and established truths.

item.title: A Comprehensive Analysis of Static Word Embeddings for Turkish
item.description: There are basically two types of word embedding models which are non-contextual (static) models and contextual models.

item.title: G-VOILA: Gaze-Facilitated Information Querying in Daily Scenarios
item.description: Modern information querying systems are progressively incorporating multimodal inputs like vision and audio.

item.title: RATLIP: Generative Adversarial CLIP Text-to-Image Synthesis Based on Recurrent Affine Transformations
item.description: Moreover, both our generator and discriminator utilize the powerful pre-trained model, Clip, which has been extensively employed for establishing associations between text and images through the learning of multimodal representations in latent space.

item.title: Hierarchical Decision Mamba
item.description: In this work, we introduce two novel methods, Decision Mamba (DM) and Hierarchical Decision Mamba (HDM), aimed at enhancing the performance of the Transformer models.

item.title: CDFormer:When Degradation Prediction Embraces Diffusion Model for Blind Image Super-Resolution
item.description: Existing Blind image Super-Resolution (BSR) methods focus on estimating either kernel or degradation information, but have long overlooked the essential content details.
